text.0:
:open_mailbox_with_raised_flag: Get our fact-checks of the week's most outrageous claims delivered straight to your WhatsApp inbox in three easy steps:

:link: Click the link https://t.co/0baDsRt6c8
:input_numbers: Save our number
:mobile_phone: Send a message with your name. https://t.co/whwDWoXr0a
text.1:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Facebook page offering free Infinix mobile phones is fake.

:warning_selector: The page uses engagement bait and is not managed by Infinix Mobile: https://t.co/StndtWsYXZ
text.2:
A photo shared on Facebook claiming to show the Kenya Sex Workers Association (KESWA) endorsing Deputy President William Ruto’s candidacy for the 2022 presidential election is ALTERED.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The photo is from 2012, and KESWA has dismissed the claim: https://t.co/w9QJXPJ2gJ
text.3:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A screenshot of a Facebook post showing US president Donald Trump praising Uganda's top military official, General David Muhoozi, is fake.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The screenshot was doctored, and the post is not on President Trump's official Facebook page: https://t.co/cjiaeLuR0D
text.4:
:detective_medium-dark_skin_tone: Shady screenshots and phoney photos are just some of the things we investigated this week.

:page_facing_up: Here are our top stories from the past seven days:
